record.txtEvtNotes:
The prenatal Breastfeeding Seminar is a two hour lecture and discussion with a certified lactation consultant. This seminar includes orientation to successful breastfeeding, tips on dealing with the challenges of the early weeks, how both partners can participate in feeding the baby even though only one may be breastfeeding, pumping & storage of breastmilk and more. Both partners are encouraged to attend. It is recommended that this class be taken anytime in the last 2-3 months before your expected delivery date.

As with all of our classes, we encourage you to attend with your partner. During registration, one "seat" allows for the two of you to attend together.

Package Option: This class is sold separately or can be puchased as part of the First Birth & Baby Program which offers a discounted fee for a specific group of the birth preparation classes.
Package Option: This class is sold separately or can be puchased as part of the First Birth & Baby Program which offers a discounted fee for a specific group of the birth preparation classes.

Our newest class is designed for parents, grandparents and other care-givers of children 1 year of age to adolescence. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation and choking prevention techniques will be taught using child manikins as well as first aid on some of the most common childhood injuries from bee stings and sand in the eyes to bleeding, seizures and more.

When registering online, a "seat" allows for up to two participants, usually domestic partners to share the manikins and class materials.

The Becoming Parents Program is pleased to offer a new workshop based on the research of Drs. John Gottman and Julie Schwartz Gottman for expectant couples and new parents in the first postpartum trimester.

Bringing Baby Home is a two part class taught by Certified Gottman Educators. The Workshop Goals include:

  • Learn what to expect during the transition to parenthood

  • Learn how to strengthen friendship, intimacy and conflict regulation skills

  • Learn about child development and how to co-parent with your partner


Upcoming 2013 dates are:
Two Sundays, September 22 & 29: 10am-3:30pm
The class is held over two weekend days as listed above. The date listed in the registration is the starting date and time of the first class. The fee listed is per couple.

Learn more about Bringing Baby Home and the Gottman Institute at www.bbhonline.org.

Read the article "So Cute, So Hard on a Marriage" from the Wall Street Journal at http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704099704576288954011675900.html.

During the orientation a description of each volunteer opportunity as well as its availability and requirements will be provided. We will also discuss necessary health clearance and security issues. An application packet will be emailed to you directly prior to the orientation. Please bring the printed packet with you to the orientation. Interviews will be scheduled within a few days of the orientation.

BLS is a course that teaches the American Heart Association Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers course. After passing written and skills examinations learners will receive the AHA BLS Healthcare Provider card (CPR & AED). The recertification classes are three hours in length.

record.txtLocName: Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Parking Garage
record.txtEvtNotes:
With 4 out of 5 car seats used incorrectly, it is important to have your child’s car seat inspected by a certified technician. Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital offers a Child Passenger Safety Seat Fitting Station for patient families as well as for the immediate community.

Certified technicians offer the following assistance to parents and caregivers:

Ensure that the seat brought by the family has not been recalled
Advise on how to choose an age, height and weight appropriate child safety seat
Instruct and demonstrate how to install and use the appropriate child safety seat in the vehicle
Instruct and demonstrate how to correctly place a child in the appropriate child safety seat
Answer any questions parents or caregivers may have regarding car seat installation.

*Please Note: Our appointments typically book out more than one month in advance. We post a new set of two week appointments on the 1st and 15th of every month. Please only schedule one appointment per immediate family, with a maximum of two vehicles. The appointments listed below are the next available spaces.
record.txtEvtAnsField06:
Con 4 de 5 asientos de automóviles usados ??incorrectamente, es importante contar con el asiento de su hijo inspeccionada por un técnico certificado. El Hospital de Niños Lucile Packard ofrece una estación de montaje Child Passenger Safety Asiento para familias de los pacientes, así como para la comunidad inmediata.
Técnicos certificados ofrecen la siguiente asistencia a los padres y cuidadores:
Asegúrese de que el asiento llevado por la familia no ha sido retirado del mercado Asesorar sobre cómo elegir una edad, altura y peso adecuado del asiento de seguridad para niños Instruir y demostrar cómo instalar y usar el asiento de seguridad apropiado en el vehículo Instruir y demostrar cómo colocar correctamente al niño en el asiento de seguridad apropiado Conteste las preguntas que los padres o cuidadores pueden haber respecto a la instalación del asiento de coche.
* Tenga en cuenta: Los cargos suelen reservar a cabo más de un mes de antelación. Publicamos un nuevo conjunto de dos citas semana en el 1 y 15 de cada mes. Por favor, sólo programar una cita por familia inmediata, con un máximo de dos vehículos. Los nombramientos se enumeran a continuación son los próximos espacios disponibles.

record.txtEvtNotes:
This is a mandatory orientation for anyone interested in the LPCH volunteer program. Please register at least 7 days before the orientation.


During the orientation, a description of each volunteer opportunity as well as its availability and requirements will be provided. We will also discuss necessary online compliance courses, health clearance, security issues, policies, and procedures. An application packet will be emailed to you a few weeks prior to the orientation date. Please bring this application to the orientation.


Interviews will be scheduled within a few days of the orientation. An interview sheet will also be emailed prior to the orientation. Please bring it filled out to your interview.


PLEASE NOTE: You must be at least 16 years old by the night of the orientation session to volunteer at Lucile Packard Children's Hospital.

record.txtEvtName: TST: A Heart to Heart Seminar: For Girls Only
record.txtEvtNotes:
This informative, humorous and lively discussion of puberty, the opposite sex and growing up sets parents and their pre-teens on a straight course for talking with one another on these important topics. Join us for these very popular classes developed by Julie Metzger, RN of "Great Conversations" in the Seattle, WA area.

"For Girls Only" is for girls, 10-12 years of age, and their moms or other adult female resource person. Each class includes discussions on the physical changes of puberty and menstruation, what girls should know about boys, social issues, sexuality and sexual reproduction.

Please note that all "Heart to Heart" classes are held in 2 sessions. The first session of your class is listed as the registration date. The second session will be held one week later on the same day of the week and at the same time.

Cancelation/Change of date Policy: Class may be canceled up to 2 weeks before the start date with a full refund. Cancelations/Change of class date made within 2 weeks of the start date of the class incur a $25 administrative fee. No refunds are given for cancelations or requests for changes of class dates made after the start of the class.

One "seat" in the registration is for one adult/child pair. Please see our webpage at www.hearttoheart.lpch.org for more information about twins and groups. You will receive an email confirmation when you submit your registration. If you do not find it please check your spam filter and search for emails from web@lpch.org. If you have any questions or need to make a class change or cancel a class please call us at 650-724-4601.

BLS is a course that teaches the American Heart Association Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers course. After passing written and skills examinations learners will receive the AHA BLS Healthcare Provider card (CPR & AED). The recertification classes are three hours in length.
Package Option: This class is sold separately or can be puchased as part of the First Birth & Baby Program which offers a discounted fee for a specific group of the birth preparation classes.

The Cesarean Birth Class is a two-hour class taught by a labor and delivery nurse childbirth educator. The class gives an overview of birth by cesarean section, discussing the reasons for such procedures, how they are done, the partner's role and the mother's recovery. It includes a film on Cesarean birth. Information about vaginal birth after Cesarean (VBAC) will also be discussed. It is recommended that this class be taken anytime in the last 2-3 months before your baby is due.


As with all of our classes, we encourage you to attend with your partner. During registration, one "seat" allows for the two of you to attend together.


Package Option: This class is sold separately or can be purchased as part of the First Birth & Baby Program which offers a discounted fee for a specific group of the birth preparation classes.
Free evening lecture for parents of adolescents and teens.

record.txtEvtName: Mothers of Sons: The Joys and Challenges of Guiding Your Son Through Adolescence
record.txtEvtNotes:
Please join us for an adult parent seminar for mothers or other trusted adult resource persons of preteen and teenage boys hosted by

Robert Lehman, MD
Co-Founder of the acclaimed "Heart to Heart" program and "Great Conversations"

Discuss adolescent male development during puberty
Understand the normal challenges between mothers and their preteen and adolescent sons
Gain ideas for how to understand and strengthen the relationship between mothers and their preteen and adolescent sons

For questions or additional program information, please call 650-724-4601.

Cancelation/Change of date Policy: Class may be canceled up to 2 weeks before the start date with a full refund. Cancelations/Change of class date made within 2 weeks of the start date of the class incur a $15 administrative fee. No refunds are given for cancelations made after the start of the class.

record.txtEvtName: Test- Mothers of Sons: The Joys and Challenges of Guiding Your Son Through Adolescence

record.txtEvtNotes:
Our Infant Safety Class prepares new parents, grandparents and other childcare providers for various aspects of newborn safety, including:

Car seats
Cribs and sleep arrangements
Poison prevention
Environmental safety in the home

As with all of our classes, we encourage you to attend with your partner. During registration, one "seat" allows for the two of you to attend together.

Baby Safe Package: Add an Infant & Child CPR class and receive a $10 discount on the combined registration fee. Use discount code "BSP" at checkout.
